main event: A witness observed a bright moving light in the sky over West Point, Nebraska on August 4, 1953, which was described as having a high rate of speed and no sound.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 60 seconds and the object traveled from NNW to SSE., The object was brighter than the surrounding stars and was visible until it disappeared behind a house., The weather conditions during the sighting were clear and the witness was a former pilot in WWII., The witness speculated that the object should have been detectable on radar given its speed., There were no sounds associated with the sighting, leading the witness to believe the object was at a considerable distance.
sighted object: a bright light moving in the sky
witness description: William A. O'Hearn, a Captain in the USAF and a former WWII pilot
